messages.subject: Getting off meds and stopping therapy
messages.msgSnippet: But, after two and a half years of living with us, she s in a different place, so we ll probably try her off the wellbutrin in a few months, probably in the
messages.messageBody:
"But, after two and a half years of
living with us, she's in a different place, so we'll probably try
her off the wellbutrin in a few months, probably in the summer."

You probably already know this, but weaning a person off of those kind
of medications might be better than just cutting it off.
I have a good friend up here that just dropped an anti-depressant and
she told me how weird it feels, physically. She knew what to expect,
so she'll get through it, but a child might have a harder time....

Ren

messages.subject: Getting off meds and stopping therapy
messages.msgSnippet: Over the last year, trust has been a big issue for us (both her trust for us and our trust for her) and unschooling has been such a blessing to us. It
messages.messageBody:
" Over the last year, trust has been a big issue for us
(both her trust for us and our trust for her) and unschooling has
been such a blessing to us. It actually allowed Shawna's heart to be
free. :-)"

This is SO incredible...chalk one up for the healing power of unschooling.
I think adoptive parents with challenged kids have an incredible
strength and commitment, those kids are really lucky to have you.
I'm so happy to hear about her growth and ability to flourish.

Thanks for sharing that Joanne...very cool.

Ren
